website_summaries.verdict: A bare bones system that will save you money and protect you from many, but not all, hazardous water elements.
pros: A basic, two-stage system that reduces many harmful elements in drinking water
cons: Limited filtration prevents the Watts from eliminating arsenic, chrome, and other nitrates
Filters can be difficult to change

customer_reviews.title: Good drinking water, no hassle.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the "on the faucet" drinking water filters, and decided it was time for something less in the way. For the money, I don't think this can be beat. Our water usually has a fairly strong chlorine taste/smell to it, but not with this filter. Installation was a snap. It's one of the best things I've done for my kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Cotharyus

customer_reviews.title: Was extremely easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely easy to hook up. It included a connector to add to the existing water line. I didn't even bother to replace the faucet, since my old faucet worked fine and was white, which I wanted and not stainless. I was just able to go buy a $5 quick-connect 3/8" to 1/4" connector and push the tubes in. Turned it on and no leaks anywhere. The thing I don't like is the 3/8" line, which really restricts the water flow compared to my old 1/4" line, but most of the ones I looked at on Amazon seem to now have the 3/8" lines.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: For your health.
customer_reviews.text: Filter makes the city water taste great. The real test is to put tap water in a bottle and leave it overnight. Then in the morning open the lid and smell all the sulfur and other compounds in your water. Then do the same with the filtered water, it'll smell like nothing in the morning. I love it. I drink so much more water now, than I did before the filer. And I'm not wasting money and effort buying, carrying, and storing bottles. Got a hydroflask and now I stay hydrated all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, But Do THIS
customer_reviews.text: Hooked everything up and worked great, until the plastic hose popped off the filter and water sprayed EVERYWHERE. So, when you install and tighten the plastic hoses to your existing plumbing ALSO tighten them on the unit, as the factory was only finger tight. If I hadn't been sitting 5 feet away with the sink cabinets still open, I wouldn't have caught it and it would have flooded my place. CHECK ALL FITTINGS FOR TIGHTNESS! and enjoy great tasting water ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Charles I.

customer_reviews.title: Product does what it claims. Purchase the wrench to make your install easier
customer_reviews.text: Installation took all of about 10 minutes. Having purchased the wrench before hand helped. Highly recommend that you do that. Surprised it doesn't come with it. Product does work well but don't care for the plastic flip handle/switch to turn on and off the water.
customer_reviews.author: K Appleyard

customer_reviews.title: Filter great. Plumbing hokey.
customer_reviews.text: As a previous reviewer said, the unit is really nice. However, the teensy tubing is silly. I'm not gonna trust it under my sink and I have purchased some icemaker hoses to replace it. You'll also need to replace the really cheapo valve on the thing with a "Supply Stop Extender Tee" that's 3/8" x 3/8" x 1/4". Yeah it costs a few more bucks, but it may save you a flood later. The inlet on the water tap is a nice narrow threaded metal tube. It saves having to use a hole punch should you be missing that extra hole. A drill bit should work just fine. So, it's good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Technophilos

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces, leaky and additional cost to install!
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived missing a critical fitting that could not be locally sourced! The hardware store could not match the threads, called the manufacture wasted another half hour and I did not get anywhere so I now have to buy another spigot for $30. I hate when products do not come complete. I would not recommend this and I am stuck with it because I did not install as soon as I received it. Once I had it installed the faucet leaked. I contacted Watts and was told I had to go back to retailer they would not help me. I only purchased due to excellent reviews. I can not recommend the anymore.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do, BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: This does what it is supposed to do - provide taste free, clean water. I am disappointed, however, that the flow is less than I expected. We have great water pressure. This was bought to replace a single 5 year Watts filter, but once installed the water flow was greatly reduced from the single filter. My long-time plumber installed the filers, checked that the water flow direction was correct and the filters were installed correctly. He finally said that that's the way it is. It's only for drinking water so it's not critical, but why design something that cannot even match a much less expensive approach?
customer_reviews.author: Soaring-Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Based on the reviews, I went easy on the inline plastic valve when tightening it. It started to drip after a few days, so I made it a little tighter in the valve and it hasn't leaked since. The faucet is nice. It puts out a decent stream of water. Fills a gallon container surprisingly fast. I don't LOVE it because it doesn't have a UV filter built into it, but neither does anything else I could find. After reading up on all that, we probably don't need one anyway. :)
customer_reviews.author: NJ/SC Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great filter system.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, I went to the local hardware store and bought brass fittings to replace the plastic one provided with this item. Once it is installed the water will have a lot of tiny bubbles that make the water look cloudy, but goes away after a while. Pretty much like most water filters. Good quality and design, water tastes great now, no more chemical smells or any metalic taste, depending on your water supply.
customer_reviews.author: zranktor

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment
customer_reviews.text: The equipment itself is working well and Ali parts needed were included. The taste of the water is not good. But I know I can get a different brand replacement filters. For this price it's worth it even just for getting the equipment alone.
customer_reviews.author: sdfdfvbjhklj

customer_reviews.title: Watts 500313 2-Stage Undercounter Lead, Cyst & VOC Reducing Drinking Water System
customer_reviews.text: We have well water so we used this system (the filter portion) in back of a 20micron sediment filter and as a prefilter in front of a UV light bacterial purifier. Installation was relatively easy although I did go to the local hardware store for an adapter to 1/2 copper for the input to the filter. Water tastes great and systems faucet works great when used appropriately. Was a good purchase for us. Note: If your water pressure is low water flow will be slow but that is mostly a function of the 5 and 1 micron filters.
customer_reviews.author: DtD

customer_reviews.title: install was relatively easy, never fun to work under the kitchen sink
customer_reviews.text: install was relatively easy, never fun to work under the kitchen sink. green line has tiny leak. not sure how to fix Filtered water was cloudy and had a strange after taste. ran the water for a good 10 minutes to clear look and flavor, still not sure what to replace plastic bottles with transport water with.
customer_reviews.author: colin p wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Drinkable water now!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars except for the plastic lines provided. The universal valve was worthless in my application. Went to the local hardware and picked up two 6 foot 1/4 inch flexible reinforced water lines and a 3 way valve. $ 15 and 30 minutes to install. Major difference in water quality. No more bottled water. We and the cats would not drink the tap water here in central Fl. Horrible aroma and taste. They drink the filtered water now. That should tell you something. Iced tea is great. Do not have to use bottled water anymore.
customer_reviews.author: John Agee

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, water tastes like water again and not ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, water tastes like water again and not like a chlorinated pool. Faucet water pressure isn't great, but we can live with it. We fill up a pitcher while moving around the kitchen then pour glasses of water from it. Big plus, no water waste like the reverse osmosis systems.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit worried with some of the bad reviews that were posted but after 7 months of use I have to say its a great unit. With two kids and parents that drink nothing but coffee and water we use 2-3 gallons per day, water pressure is fine, turn it on, fill a glass or jug and you're good to go. We swap out the filters more than recommended, every 4 vs every 6 months. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Leslee C.

customer_reviews.title: Mineral taste...
customer_reviews.text: Hooking this up was pretty easy and at first I was nervous as the attachments seemed like they would be prone to leaking- but they do not. We used to have a cheap filter that fit on the faucet and I thought that for sure the Watts would be tons better. I think it actually does filter out the nasty stuff, but the taste is really strange. It's like a mineral flavor or something. I don't mind the taste, but my wife doesn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: mannyn

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable filtration system
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this filtration system. We opted for the second highest filter level and it's made a world of difference in the way our water tastes. We switched from a Pur faucet filter and our water tastes so much better now. It took my husband about 30-45 minutes to install the filter system and we didn't need to cut any additional holes for the spigot because we had a hole for a sprayer already. I'm waiting to see how long the filter lasts, but so far we're very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rada-Mina

customer_reviews.title: Careful what lines you use
customer_reviews.text: I installed this unit with braided plastic lines made for refridgerator icemakers from home depot.I didn't want to use the flimsey looking plastic lines included with the filter. My water tasted awful. I returned this filter and got a different brand and installed that and it tasted awful too. It turns out it was the lines I was using. I switched over to copper lines and my water tastes great. I think I would have kept this filter with the copper lines. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE AND PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I already has this filter for myself and love it, so I purchased this one as a gift. I feel that where I live the water from the tap is good, however I can not stand the chlorine smell or taste so that was the main reason to get this filter. I thought the reverse osmosis system was just over the top and not needed where I live.

customer_reviews.title: Sheiza

I would only warn you to be sure the canisters are tightly on before turning on the flow.

I has to make a # of tips to various hardware store to find parts to fit the filter cartriges. The reduced price was not worth the time, effort and cleanup resulting from this defect. Buy locally and you can get problems like this taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: John Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, attractive and economical.

It is so much easier than a Brita or the kind you screw in to your faucet. The plummer had no problems installing it. It is such a convenience. The price was right too.

My parents have used it for years and never had a problem except for the cheap tap.

customer_reviews.title: It's a filter

I replaced a reverse osmosis system that was noisy and getting more expensive every year to maintain. The water techs would tell me this or that needed replacing and the bill was always north of $150. I received the WP-2 LVC system quickly and it was easy to install. I replaced the included plastic elbows with metal fittings from Lowe's. The water tastes good and no leaks! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: williard harris

customer_reviews.title: This unit works fine, although the flow is pretty slow with 1/4" ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works fine, although the flow is pretty slow with 1/4" fittings. The filters are reasonably priced. I did not experience any problems with the install.

customer_reviews.title: Great water filter

But the unit itself produces very good water. It takes about 2.5 minutes to fill a gallon jug and you get about 600 gallons from a set of filter canisters.

I send them pictures of the broken unit and they have stopped contacting me. I would suggest to stay away as you do not want to take chances. customer_reviews.title: Does not filter well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Watts 500313 2-stage filter now for 2 months and almost every day tested the water with a TDS (Total Dissolved Solutes) test meter (by HM Digital Inc.). At the same time, I also compared our regular tap water and purified bottled water (made by reverse osmosis). The filter has always yielded near identical results to the tap water (plus or minus 5% occasionally). The RO water was always very low ...about 90% lower than tap and filter. Needless to say, I am very disappointed in this product from Watts. RO systems are only ones that work, but unfortunately difficult to install and operate and inefficient.

Two-stage filtration removes VOCs to give you cleaner water straight from the tap.

During the lifecycle of a single filter, you can save up to 16,000 plastic bottles from being deposited in landfills. Two-Stage Filtration Removes Contaminants
The Watts WP-2 filters drinking water in two stages. Once the system is connected, water from the tap passes through a five-micron sediment filter, followed by a heavy-duty one-micron carbon block filter that reduces lead, parasytic cysts, and chemicals. This specially formulated filtration process is capable of reducing cryptosporidia, giardia, entamoeba, and toxoplasma, as well as a long list of chemicals--from herbicides and pesticides to disinfection byproducts and gas additives.Cleaner Water Straight from the Tap
It is estimated that VOCs (volatile organic chemicals) are present in one-fifth of the nation's water supplies. These contaminants can enter ground water from a variety of sources, including herbicide and pesticide runoff, gasoline or oil spills, leaking underground fuel tanks, disinfection byproducts, septic system cleaners, and chemicals used in the dry cleaning industry.

The WP-2 keeps you safe from these and other chemicals with its two-stage filtration, so you can turn on the tap with the assurance that you're getting cleaner, healthier drinking water.

The Importance of Drinking Clean Water
Water is critical to proper food digestion, kidney health, brain function, blood health, joint functionality, and more. It's important to make sure that the water you drink is devoid of contaminants. Thankfully, using a Watts water filtration device will ensure consistent quality for all of your drinking and cooking needs. In fact, when you use Watts' high-quality certified water treatment devices and filters, your water will be free of chlorine taste and odors, particles, and many other contaminants that can be detrimental to your health.

*Please refer to the Performance Data Sheet for the complete list of claims for which this system is certified.


Not only is the WP-2 filter a healthy choice for you, but it's also a healthy choice for the environment. This filter helps you minimize the harmful environmental consequences of buying bottled water. Incredibly, if a mere ten percent of North America's bottled water intake were reduced by switching to home-filtered water in reusable containers, we could eliminate:



 * 133,000 trucks driving an average of 500 miles--saving nearly 12 million gallons of diesel fuel
 * Over 100 million pounds of greenhouse gasses--equal to taking 1,100 cars off the road annually
 * 213 million pounds of PET--equal to 1.5 million barrels of crude oil or improving the PET recycling rate by 10%



Depending upon which Watts water-filtration product you use, you can prevent up to 16,000 half-liter bottles from being deposited in landfills--all in the time it takes to use and replace a single filter.The Watts Premier WP-2 LCV Water Filtration Device is backed by a three-year limited warranty. 

What's in the Box
WP-2 LVC unit with mounting bracket (complete with filters), standard faucet assembly, parts bag, and manual.
